name: Portola Hotel & Spa at Monterey Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was eagerly anticipating our stay at the Portola. Unfortunately, we booked online. We were told when we arrived (at 6 p.m.!) that the Web site (in cooperation with the telelphone reservation staff) regularly overbooks rooms. So they didn't have the upgraded king-sized bed with a view that we had ordered for a nonholiday weekend in September. They told us at least six other couples were similarly out of luck.
reviews.title: I wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They offered to give us a mere $20 off and put us in a room with two queens -- "oh, but they're oversized queens," they told us. "It's a very nice room." Essentially, instead of upgrading us, they downgraded us.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise - Would Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, you can see where this is going. The room was beyond tiny and the beds were doubles at best. The view was "the courtyard" but didn't look a whole lot nicer than a driveway, in my opinion. So much for looking at the ocean!
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.liked: — room decor and size and staff

reviews.text: My husband and I decided that instead of paying about $220 for the honor of sleeping in separate beds, we would drive home. First, we brushed our teeth. The sink wouldn't drain. Gross. Our minds were made up.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Staff, No A/C!

likes.liked: — The Location, near wharf, hotel is lovely

reviews.text: The front-desk staff was nice, but seemed perplexed that we weren't satisfied with our $20 discount (I mean, really? $20 bucks if you're prepared to spend $300?) and free breakfast coupon. We weren't looking to stay for free, but an upgrade seems to have been the solution that they were unwilling to consider, especially considering it was their fault with overbooking. There were nicer rooms available.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great service

likes.disliked: — Lack of mini bar in room but now I'm being picky!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Portola Hotel in Monterey. The location is right next to Fisherman's Wharf which is very convenient. The lobby is nice and the breakfast buffet at Jack's is pretty good (for a buffet). The hotel does allow pets (saw several dogs), so be aware you might have a noisy neighbor. The front desk staff was very helpful and the free cookies when you check in are delicious. Parking is $17 a night. You can definitely walk to locations like the State Beach, Aquarium and Cannery Row (1+ miles away).
reviews.title: A few nights in Monterey

reviews.text: Nice hotel. Room we had was adequate. Only issues- overlooked walkway that got a little noisy. Also, could not control air in room; only heat. Saving grace was the overhead fan. Rooms were clean, beds comfy.
reviews.title: Monterey, california

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kudos to Jennifer at front desk! She was courteous and very helpful on the phone and was as friendly in person when we checked in.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, but need more work with cleanliness

reviews.text: The (slight) disappointment came when we checked into the room. Bathroom was a little dated (that's fine), but the bathtub didn't look clean and had dark spots all over, maybe bleach would fix that? not sure?
reviews.title: Room 463 is loud!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was also some nut shells (not from us) around the sofa area when we checked in. Not the cleanliness I would've expected for that rate, a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: OK Hotel in a Great Location
Good Location , but not worth $500.00 per night
reviews.text: We just arrived today August 4, 2007 and are frequent travellers. The location is good if you like to be near the marina and some pubs. We paid $499.00 plus tax for room 627 and it is maybe worth $100.00 during prime season. There is not even a fridge in the room and they want you to pay for parking $15.00 per day and internet $9.95. The pool is across the street and it is soooo small, that we thought it was the kids splash pool. All they go for is the location. Alot of batter, but not much meat. I hope this helps.

My family and I spent 2 nights at the Portola Plaza Hotel. The hotel is conveniently located by Fisherman's Wharf. We parked our car upon check in--$15 per day, valet is $18 per day, and never moved the car until we checked out. We were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Canery Row, and the aquarium. The walk to the aquarium is 1.2 miles one way, but is a nice walk and my two children ages 8 and 10 didn't complain during the walk to the aquarium and opted to walk back to the hotel instead of taking the free hotel trolley.
reviews.title: Portola Plaza Hotel --very convenient location

reviews.text: We found all of the hotel staff very friendly and helpful, and the chocolate chip cookies we were given upon arrival were delicious and very welcoming. The resturant on site was very convenient for breakfast, but a little pricey.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: Other than the convenient location of the hotel and friendly and helpful staff, we did find some areas of this hotel less than what we had hoped for. We found this hotel to be very pricey when you consider that you must pay an additional $15 a day to park, and $10 a day for a refrigerator in your room over the room price of above $200 a night. We found the room to be an average hotel room, although clean, the room was nothing fancy and rather small. The balcony in our room overlooked the street , but made the room very noisy. We heard traffic noise throughout the night. All in all, this was an ok hotel, but we will look to stay elsewhere upon our return to Monterey.
reviews.title: Mostly fine.

reviews.text: We only stayed one night, but the room was very nice - beds were very comfortable especially after a long day of driving and sight seeing. The staff was helpful in telling us where to go to enjoy food and drinks at a local pub. The location is within walking distance to everything. All that and some warm cookies at check in and a rubber seal on the bathtub :o). The soap and creams were Bath and Body Works- nice touch. There were some beautiful hotels by Cannery Row but obviously more than what we paid for at Portola Plaza Hotel. FYI - Parking is $18 per night extra for valet. Overall, great experience.
reviews.title: Always a Great Stay

reviews.text: • The pool was fine for my 8- & 11-year-old kids to play around in. Towels were provided at the pool. The pool furniture was padded and of excellent quality.
reviews.title: Average: Features and problems balance out.

reviews.text: • The rollaway provided was very good, almost didn't mind paying the extra $20.
reviews.title: Clean Room, Yummy Cookies

reviews.text: • The location is nice for walking around town, & down to the docks to see sea lions. You can walk to the aquarium, but it's a long walk. But a nice one.
reviews.title: Awesome location, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • The thermostat is deceptive- it only controls hot air, there is no AC-you have to rely on the balcony screen door and fan for air. It's cool at night so near the water so it's no big deal, the room was just stuffy when we first got in.
reviews.title: Platinum floor facing water--fantastic!

reviews.text: •The toilets are noisy. And you can hear *every* *single* *one* surrounding you.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay at Portola Plaza

reviews.text: We were impressed starting to the warm welcome from the Valet parking and easy check in top the friendly and helpful departure.
reviews.title: Quality establishment in great location
Good...but extra costs
reviews.text: We found the rooms comfortable - great beds, and clean and quiet.

The staff were without exception professional. I was particularly impressed that the concierge staff take the time to learn and use the names of the majority of their guests. it is the little things like this that make the difference.
reviews.title: nice, comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful and there is a good choice of restaurants nearby. Also if you like wine try the little shop across the road. Owners are wonderful people and really know their California wine.
reviews.title: Location and service was great...BUT...

reviews.text: Also - remember to eat breakfast here. For the price we paid (about $17 each) service and choice is fantastic and they make great mimosa!
reviews.title: lived up to expections

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights and would have stayed longer if time permitted. The lobby is one that cannot be matched anywhere, since it is filled with large trees growing under skylights. As special as the lobby is, the staff easily exceeds the standard set by the lobby appearance. Upon checking in I was provided with an undated guide to area resturants and a booklet listing the museums and parks found on the Monterey Peninsula. The room was large and extremely clean. The furnishings were attractive and the star of the room was the glass sliding doors that allow access to the wonderful fresh air from the bay. Our room on the sixth floor had an unobstructive view of the marina and the bay. The service staff was attentive and friendly, and though self-parking was a little expensive, the (in&out) convience more than made up for the cost. Enjoyed walking through the farmer's market on Tuesday evening beginning just across the street from the hotel.
reviews.title: Centerpiece of Monterey

reviews.text: The portola hotel was a great spot for us. We booked initially through expedia, but canceled our reservation because portola honored their low rate guarantee. That was a good start to our visit. The hotel is right in the center of downtown monterey which is great. Walking distance to many shops, restaurants and the wharf. We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. Our room was clean and very comfortable. The layout of the hotel is unique so you actually wander through some different complexes to get to your unit, but it makes it feel a little more private that way. We brought our dogs and the hotel has an excellent pet friendly policy. The layout made having the pets fantastic. We had easy access to walking areas without having to go through the main lobby which was great for any late night or early morning needs. We had our own balcony which was a nice perk, and yet we still felt secluded. The staff at the hotel was friendly to our pets coming and going. The only things I didn't like were that the parking was $17 per night for self park and $20 for valet, and they charged for wi-fi. I know parking is limited in monterey but an additional $20 per night seemed a little excessive, I would prefer to have it built in to the room rate. I also understand that advertising gets you on the lower rate, so just plan on an additional $20-$30 a night for parking and wi-fi. Everything else about the property was great. We had a comfortable bed with nice pillows. Room was updated with nicer amenities. We couldn't have found a better fit in monterey for our needs with pets and for convenience. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location and unique layout. Pet Friendly!
Good Location...walk to everything
reviews.text: After getting an amazing deal on priceline we stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of September. The hotel is nice and LARGE!! The room was decent size and clean. The only thing I would mention, since you are getting such a great deal through priceline, they don't guarantee a specific size room or location. My husband and I were assigned 2 double beds that were extremely far from the elevator.

Completely positive experience from making the reservations all the way through to checking out The rooms are modern and pristine. Breakfast was delicious-a great buffet. The staff was friendly. Convenient location next to wharf. Very reasonable pricing. Warm cookies given upon arrival-nice touch. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a awesome location, its a short walk to the wharf and all the tourist activities and restaurants. Our room was large, with a King bed which was very soft and comfy. We had a large well appointed bathroom, and a lounge area opening with shutters to a large patio area. Nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location

reviews.text: Visiting family in our hometown, we decided to get a hotel to have our own space during the trip and make a getaway out of visiting friends and family. We got a room on the 7th floor with an amazing view of the fishermans warf. We loved seeing our city in a new way and having everyone come to visit at the hotel and walk to lunch and dinner-- there are tons of places in walking distance. Rooms are large and so tastefully decorated. Our room had a window seat and really unique extras: books, pillows etc... Two morning we called for coffee to be delivered and it was at the door within 5 minutes- amazing.
reviews.title: Felt like a tourist in my hometown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Monterey walking/rec trail is just a few steps away.
reviews.title: Night and Day in Monterey

reviews.text: - old fishermans warf has delicious clam chowder
reviews.title: Beautiful but noisy

reviews.text: - walk to Lou Lou's on the next warf over for a breakfast treat
reviews.title: Absolutely Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - self parking is $17/day for secure, covered lot. Being from this area, I can tell you that's a steal! Only other parking within about a mile is 2hr max or meters, and the parking enforcement in Monterey means business!! They will ticket you at 2hr 1min.... Seriously! With everything in walking distance and trolleys and cans available, you really don't even need a car. We had ours in the garage most of the 3 days except to drive to a golf course in Carmel valley.
reviews.title: Great spot in Monterey

reviews.text: This hotel completely exceeded our expectations. We found a great deal in travelzoo! We had recently gotten a puppy so the first criteria was that the hotel had to be dog friendly and clean while being dog friendly. This was perfect! When we checked in, we were greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies and our dog was given dog bone biscuits!! Our room was very spacious with a beautiful big patio outside. It was nice to just open the plantation shutters and enjoy the breeze from outside. The bed was by far the best bed I've ever slept in and I've traveled to many different places. The swimming pool was gorgeous!! The location is perfect. You are literally right in front of fishermans wharf. There's also a trail just steps away that leads you straight to cannery row and the monterey bay aquarium. It's about a 1.2 mile walk each way... The breakfast buffet at the hotel was just wonderful!!! We are planning to book another 3 nights in July and around the holidays. Thus would be a great pla e to just unwind and relax! Try it and you will find yourself looking for an excuse to go back again and again! For dog lovers, there is a beautiful and clean big beach in Carmel by downtown that allows dogs to go offleash.
reviews.title: A luxurious weekend getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only do they allow dogs, but they can provide beds and bowls for your buddy! There is a patio at the Brew pub where you can share dinner and have a pint. It is also next to dog friendly Fishermans Warf and there are miles of beachfront paths for long walks.
reviews.title: Bring your dog!
A jewel
reviews.text: This may be a perfect hotel. My sister and I did a girl night out. The room was beautiful and quiet, the restaurant excellent, the spa wonderful and reasonably priced treatments. Best of all, it is right onthe walking path at fisherman's wharf...and no car noise outside and a magnificent "back yard."

So, we got our first experience of the Portola Hotel. The hotel wasn't like "OMG this is beautiful" but more like " Eh, this is nice... and interesting... but I've had better." I had asked for a double Portola room with a view of the beach and a balcony. We were accomidated the room, a balcony, but if we wanted to see anything, besides the back of a night club's brick wall we'd have to stand on the two chairs on the balcony and look over faaaarrr to the right. Anyhow, that was a total bummer. :( The room was comfortable, it's like every other hotel room. The toilet didnt flush well, and we were very limited on hot water from the sink and shower heads. :( So while trying to shower, you'd get luke warm water, and then a gush of cold and then a gush of blazing hot would pour out on top. so strange. On our second night there, my sisters and I were returning to our room from shopping. It was approximately 6 pm and there were ZERO parking spaces in their garage! So I called the front desk and the guy whom had answered stated that we can park down the street, about 3-4 blocks away from the hotel, and we'd just have to walk to the hotel (in the pouring rain). Also, there was going to be a $7.00 charge each time we'd leave the garage, even if it were only going to be for dinner or something. So what ever, we just sat around the garage, and finally, after 30-45 minutes of doing so, a couple left so we took their vacant spot. The girls and I spent an hour or so, soaking in their hot tub and swimming in their pool, in the rain. That was very nice only except, my lips were completely salty. EEWW gross! Upon check out, we found that our TV remote didn 't work, why? I don't know. So I called downstairs and checked out. With the prices here, I think I'd rather fork out a little less to stay at the Best Western... I mean, you'd pay less, get the beach view... heck, you'd be on the beach!!! So, thanks PORTOLA, BUT NO THANK YOU.
reviews.title: The exterior of the hotel is very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Portola several times and have always enjoyed our stay. The hotel is well managed with a friendly staff and clean, inviting rooms. On our recent stay we were pleased to see that the decor had been updated and the rooms had a nice, fresh look. Our stay included breakfast and a very nice lady cooked us an omelette each morning in the beautiful restaurant. One of the best things about the Portola is the location - across the street from downtown Monterey with several excellent restaurants and coffee houses - and adjacent to Monterey Pier which hosts a number of fantastic restaurants. Additionally, if you like to walk or bike, a beautiful wide trail passes by the hotel which leads to Cannery Row and the Monterey Aquarium. Perfect!!! We will be back next year for sure!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.text: nice room, beautiful lobby and property. don't know how they can call it a spa, though. the pool and spa were closed for repairs when we were there last thurs/friday, which is the main reason my wife accompanied on this business trip for meetings at this location. Strong paint smell in hall on our floor; hard to swallow their charge for internet access; nowadays it's expected, especially with $200 a night charges, $15/d to park car, resort fee, taxes, etc. Most properties down there likewise charge for everything. Food was a bit disappointing for the price.
reviews.title: Portola a nice hotel but not a spa

reviews.text: They charge extra for everything. The staff seems nice, but you will be charged $5 for an ethernet cable to get 768kbp net speed. The rooms are tired and dated. They are trying to be modern by giving you a warm cookie upon check in. At the same time the dingyou $5 for an ethernet cable. My toilet made a sound like it was going to crack when sitting on it. I would avoid this place like the plague. Monterey is a beautiful place. Don't let The hotel Portola kill it for you.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel.

likes.disliked: — sr. management decisions to charge for everything

reviews.text: We stayed there for a conference for 2 nights. It was great, the location, the ambiance etc. The walk to the wharf is 2 minutes. There's a beach, sea lions, ships, everything you like when you don't live on the ocean. Now to the complaints, and I'm complaining on a high level so be aware of that. 1) Everything costs extra. The cable for the internet access (no wireless!), the internet access ($15 per day!), parking ($15 per day!), etc. 2) We had loud neighbors and the walls are very thin. 3) The walk to your room can take longer than to the wharf. What else might be good to know...well you get a cookie at check-in. There's construction right now (pool and spa and fitness rooms closed!).
reviews.title: Not bad a hotel and location, but everything costs extra

reviews.text: We had a great time here. Our room had a small balcony. The location is very close to the Fisherman's Warf and a wonderful walking trail. Although our room was next to the elevator, there was no noise from it. Staff was friendly, food at breakfast good. I would recommend it. Website has great internet specials.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location, Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — one way streets made it hard to find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through hotels.com, and paid about $155 per night. This did not include $15/day for parking and $9.95/day for internet access. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend, but she stipulated that it "depends on the section of the hotel you get." Well, we ended up facing the plaza. Although the room was cute, it was smaller than expected. Because we stayed for 4 nights, I was annoyed that we had no refrigerator. There was a lot of noise from the plaza (people walking through and carts being rolled through), and the walls were very thin. You can also hear sea lions barking from the Wharf area throughout the night and during the day. The room was dusty, despite the maids coming in once during our stay.
reviews.title: Hotel not that great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel thru a travelzoo.com deal for $149/night and 1/2 off parking (normal parking price is $15/nite) for a Fri-Sun Easter weekend. Loved the warm and delicious chocolate chip cookies at check-in. Bathroom has Bath & Body Works products and a cute rubber seal. We are a sightseeing couple so didn't mind that the pool/hot tub were under renovation at all. some minor problems were thin bathroom walls. For some reasons we can hear our neighbor flushes! and it was quite loud! But i'm a heavy sleeper so as soon as i fell asleep it was OK. Another thing was not much to do at night in Monterey... so would had been nice to have a DVD player in the room. Be sure to walk down the street on Alvarado St for yummie breakfast at Old Monterey Cafe :)~
reviews.title: Cozy place , walking distance to fisherman's wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Orbitz at the last minute and got a $210 room for $150. This price was about right. Warm cookies at check-in and tastful, modern room. The location is great - we walked to Fisherman's Wharf, historic sites downtown, and strolled the bike path along the waterfront just under a mile to Cannery Row. Room service made a yummy pizza to our specifications. We arranged a kayak tour of the bay at the Adventures By the Bay shop on the hotel grounds. Heated pool and hot tub warmed us up after a chilly paddle in the Bay. Hotel gave us a late check out 2 hours beyond the 12 noon time. At a discount price cheaper than many of the fancy B&B's in town, we got more amenities and a better location here. We'd stay again.
reviews.title: A great last minute deal

reviews.text: We stayed at the Portola Hotel during a cold winter weekend and had a fantastic experience. The hotel was in walking distance to many restaurants and shops. We booked our room through Orbitz and found a great deal. Our room didn't have a view, but very spacious and clean. Our only complaint was hearing the sea lions very early in the morning. Of course, we had a few laughs over this during breakfast. We were there to experience Monterey, after all. The 17-mile drive & aquarium were fantastic and highly recommend taking the time to visit this is your first Monterey trip.
reviews.title: Fabulous Monterey Hotel

reviews.text: We just stayed here for one night on our way down to LA from SF. We got a cheap rate on their web site ($ 149 for a deluxe room with free parking). The staff was friendly and very service minded. The room was nice and the location of the hotel is great. Garage is just outside the hotel for easy parking.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated beautifly with wonderful views of Fisherman's Wharf. The parking was great as the hotel has it's own garage and there were always plenty of spaces available, even with the hotel sold out. Check in was fast and friendly and they give you delicious cookies when you check in. Our first room was nice. We booked the deluxe king room and had a nice partial ocean view with a balcony. Our room was not cleaned prior to our occupying it. When we called the front desk to let them know that the sheets wern't changed (stained linens-very dirty and gross), nor was the furniture cleaned (sticky spots) or even the vanity or toilet (hair everywhere) cleaned, we were given complimentary drinks in their bar and waited an hour to return to our room so that it could be properly cleaned. Upon returning to the room, we found clean sheets but all the rest of the issues were still there. We called the front desk again, this time really upset by the filth in the room, and were told that we could wait in the hall while they again "brushed up" our room. We said ok then changed our minds in a minute because it was almost 10 pm now. We figured that all we needed were clean sheets to sleep anyway.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I stayed there for an education conference a few years back. Had a great experience then and really enjoyed our stay for a second time. Very open lobby area with easy access to the gym and pool facilities. Restaurants and bars are warm and enjoyable. The staff throughout the hotel were friendly and cooperative at every level. Spa choices were plentiful and reasonably priced. Dog friendly, but we did not bring our dog. Location is superb! Two minute walk to old Fisheman's Wharf, very good clam chowder and history. Easy twenty minute walk along a very beautiful walking/biking trail to Cannery Row and the best aquarium on the West Coast. Easy walk to more downtown shopping and a nice large beach area. Room was very nice and we were able to really relax for a few days.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful ambiance!

reviews.text: From the time we arrived until leaving, each and every hotel staff were inconspicuous, extremely friendly, and always helpful. We attended to support a high school event and left feeling we had a relaxing getaway from home. The local area had many nice shops and small or longer walking paths. The rooms were comfortable, especially the bedding and I have a problem back.
reviews.title: Truely Relaxing

reviews.text: Worth every penny that we spent. Parking was easy.
reviews.title: Happy with location and service but one problem...

reviews.text: I stayed three days at the Portola, hotel is very nice, clean, outstading service, very good breakfast, my only problem was the room when i was about to sleep, the only thing that you hear is toilets being flushed, toilets from the rooms around your room; this was the major problem for me. the bathroom was ok, the sink looks old, but it was clean. COncierge lady was nice and gave us a coupon for complimentary appetizzer for Domenico's restaurant.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, how about some soundproofing?

reviews.text: Based on a horrible experience over 10 years ago, we haven't been back. The problem back then was noise. My husband, daughter and I got no sleep whatsoever. Our room was near a loud party that did not end. The property was a DoubleTree at the time and I contacted Hilton Honors about the non response we received from hotel management.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the 'basic' rooms, nothing over the top. The hotel was amazing!! Parking was a bit difficult, so we decided to just do the valet option.
reviews.title: a real treat...

reviews.text: Sadly, there was a major power outtage during our stay. Three cities lost power, the hotel was included. However, staff was beyond helpful. They had flashlights and very quick to provide updates as they got them.
reviews.title: A Rare Experience

reviews.text: Yummy, warm cookies were a treat at check-in!!
reviews.title: It was just ok...

reviews.text: P.S. -- We got an AMAZING price for our room. It was about $100 when booked on Priceline!!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: This April-May put us on the road and to a test. In less than 3 weeks we had to be in 6 different locations. Portola Hotel stood out in exceeding our every expectation. We stayed in a double bed room - the least expensive accomodation. The layout was great and the decor with its dark mahogony harmonized with the lightness of the spacious room. The TV was huge and we enjoyed the in-the-movie-theater effect. The matresses, and Egyptian-cotton bedding were in the "Perfect+" category and so were the gentle hair-care toiletries. Everything was airy, breezy and troublefree. But all this pales in comparison with the hotel attitude. After a gruelling 7 hour drive from SoCal we arrived at 5 am. Yes, 5 am, so as to be in Monterey for a midday ceremony. What would one expect from a facility that has a 3 pm check-in time? An offer to store our bags? A polite insistance on paying a half-day rate? We got a smile and a set of keys. Give me a voting machine and we would vote Portolla Hotel and Spa as "The Hotel With a 5 star Heart".
reviews.title: It had a Keurig!

reviews.text: There are hotels in the area that are much nicer for the price. No ammenities for the price, rude reception. (oh they give you a cookie to make up for that) We stayed for a Wedding. I booked the room 2 months in advance. Yet was given a room in an ajacent building accross a very busy walkway that leads to the Pier. Noisy at 6am with foot traffic and carts being pulled .
reviews.title: Location, Location, that's about all you get. Noisy- Overpriced

reviews.text: My Sister booked the night of the stay and received an ajoining room with my family at a better rate. . I approached the staff with my concerns and they didn't care a bit. I tried to check in 30 minutes early and was refused. We booked several rooms and where treated like dirt. Go somewhere where there are ammenities and have a friendly staff. There are many in the area for same price or better.
reviews.title: Great Business Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean but didnt even have a bottle of water as far as ammenities. Older Hotel I have worked in Customer Service for many years and the reception gets a D-
reviews.title: Surprised and Delighted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited for a business event on premises. First time to the facility and was favorably impressed. Location is downtown - not waterfront, but well situated, within walking distance of several restaurants, lounges, etc and the water.
reviews.title: You pay for the location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel in the Monterey area that was a bit more modern. I agree that there are many properties in Carmel & Pacific Grove that would also be lovely, however we aren't big on the Victoria bed & breakfast concept. That being said, we didn't find too much in Monterey to amuse us so we definately needed the car to get to Carmel, Pacific Grove, do the 17 mile drive, etc. The room and bathroom were clean and nicely appointed. The cookie on check in was a nice touch. Would have liked to have complimentary internet, even at the computers in the lobby. Staff were attentive and helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions.
reviews.title: Good option in Monterey

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that. We did get breakfast both days at a little coffee place across the sidewalk which was reasonable and good. Would recommend the Red House in Pacific Grove for a lovely meal.
reviews.title: DO NOT stay here -- you won't sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my 2nd time here for another conference. The first time they put us by the elevator and we could here the elevator doors and dings as the doors opened -- all night!! They couldn't move us because it was a packed hotel.
reviews.title: Our TV Blew Up

likes.disliked: — The exploding TV, the mistaken early wake up by room service we didn't order, the disorganized front desk staff, the breakfast waiter who told us they were the only buffet in town when there's one across the street at the Mariott

reviews.text: I went back with my kids for a conference on May 17. The room was hot, there was no air conditioning. So you had to open your balcony sliding door. I would have except there was so much outside noise.
reviews.title: Portola Ok

reviews.text: There was the Indian Summer festival going on -- all night long. The noise was so loud that I complained numerous times to the front desk and finally asked to be moved at 1:00AM. The next room was away from the noise. However, the hotel is older and I could hear flushing of every toilet in the near vicinity - around us and above us.
reviews.title: Conference Hotel

reviews.text: The Best!!! The Portola Hotel & Spa was Amazing! The location was perfect for our little sister in law get away.. The spa was wonderful.. The rooms were nice clean and cozy and the staff was so friendly. Can't wait to go back. Paige Vierra Atascadero, CA
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this hotel was great, and the location was superb. But there are some aspects that I wish were different about this place that would've pushed it up to 5 star.
reviews.title: Love-Hate relationship with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a decent size with good amenities. There's a large 40" flat panel TV (no HD channels though), mini fridge for your snacks, and a nice Keurig coffee maker with real creamer!
reviews.title: Stayed 1 night, should have stayed 14

reviews.text: The furniture and the room is very well decorated, very modern and well designed. The minor con is that the bulbs are CFL's and they will take a while to "warm up". We were initially alarmed at the dim lighting, but the bulbs do get brighter.
reviews.title: Such a comfortable and stylish hotel

reviews.text: The balcony is tiny, but it was the perfect size for us to put our two bikes. There unfortunately is no free internet.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel! Excellent hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were satisfied with our Priceline room here. It was large with two queen doubles and everything within worked fine. We had no view but were not bothered by street or bar noises either. We were not close to the elevator but I consider that to be a positive. I did see that the back of the hotel is over a pub and nearer to the wharf and other restaurants so it may be noisier. We parked one street over and two blocks up in public parking lot #4 at Van Buren and Franklin. It is a small outdoor lot that costs $4 to park in from 9am to 6pm. After that it is free. The East and West garages a block below the hotel are $7 for 24 hours. We parked there for two nights and no one bothered our rental car in any way. The walk was good for us and we discovered the Troia Market one block up from the convention center next to the Portola where we got great sandwiches early in the morning to take on our trip down to Carmel, Point Lobos State Park, Big Sur, and McCray Falls (this last was our favorite beautiful sight of the trip). We were back by dinner time. We were not that interested in the wharf but it is right behind the hotel as is a small street with some old houses (where the pub is behind the hotel) and restaurants including a Beni Hana which might appeal to the many families we saw staying here.
reviews.title: Comfortable and centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 17 mile drive is close to town but do not see it after Big Sur as we did-it will be a let down. The Aquarium and Cannery Row were great for anyone of any age and a little better than the wharf in terms of food and sights. We ate at Jack's Restaurant in the hotel (which as said by all has a great lobby) the 1st night with a travelzoo deal of a 3 course meal for 2 for $69. Many there were using it and we were all treated well. The meal was very good value for the price but the coupon said this was a $135 deal without it. I would have been mad to have paid that much for the quality of food we had but it was good for $69. I do not think kids would like it though I am sure they would be well treated. There were too many other restaurants in the downtown area they would have a better time at including the pub we went to on the 2nd night (Crown and Anchor up and around the corner-good beer, good variety of ok food). The hotel was a good place for us for what we wanted to see and I think it is a great choice for families. Husband does not do breakfast, I went to Starbucks across the street and there is also a good Italian place on the side of the hotel where many were eating breakfast.
reviews.title: average stay

reviews.text: we booked a room with seaview, but reception mentioned they did not recieved that request. room was so called familiy room with door to the next room and therefore the room eas very noisy. I could hear my noughbour snore at night..
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Monterey with perfect location

reviews.text: Location is ok and bit strange that for such a hotel there is no free wifi
reviews.title: What it lacks in charm..

reviews.text: I love staying here with my husband, friends, or with my kids. It is perfect for everyone. This hotel has great staff and it has everything you need. Easy parking garage, bell service, and a cute pool/spa area. It is wonderful coming here to the gorgeous sea breeze. It is right on Fisherman's wharf. You probably won't have to drive around Monterey, as during the summer a trolley stops in front of the hotel to pick up passengers for Cannery Row.
reviews.title: Great Location, So-So Rooms, Wonderful People

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is the great location near the warf and within walking distance of many area attractions. In retrospect, there are other hotels nearby that I stay in if I returned. Three times during two separte nights of our stay we were awaken by a false fire alarm. There were no apologies from the staff and there was no consideration given.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — The indifference of the staff to problems

reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms were nothing special and could just as easily been found in a $75 per night hotel. Cleanliness was spotty. The hotel overcharged for parking but quickly fixed it (check the bill). All in all this was a disappointing experience.
reviews.title: Excellence

reviews.text: Excellence all around. Friendly staff. Excellent location. Great food. Great drinks.
reviews.title: Good location and fare price

reviews.text: Cheapist rate was through hotel website-other sites wanted to charge extra 40.00 for additional persons in room(2 kids).
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Clean large room. Friendly staff. Good location for Old fisherman's Wharf-right across street. Enjoyed aquarium. whale watching, Cannery row, 17 mile drive....all very close.
reviews.title: Pretty nice at Portola Plaza

likes.disliked: — long walk to room from elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is located just a short walk away from Old Downtown Monterey and just a short drive from Cannery Row. It's clean and nice, but not really worth what we paid.
reviews.title: Could have just stayed at the Holiday Inn

reviews.text: We got a Courtyard King Room For about $250 after taxes and charges. $17 for all day one day parking brought that price up. And considering what you pay for, you still have to pay extra to use the WiFi. We get free cookies though when we check in? I'll pass on the cookies and just have the internet for free.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great service all around!

reviews.text: There are a lot of families staying here, so if you are a family I suppose this doesn't affect you, but if you are traveling as a couple the noise of children running down the halls or stomping around upstairs is slightly agitating. The balcony was nice, although realistically, we didn't even utilize it. Unless you have an ocean front view, it's not worth spending the extra money. I think we could have gotten a much better value at a Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Nice Room

reviews.text: Arrived late. The staff was amazing. We had a whiney toddler and were exhausted. The manager came and assisted us with our luggage. We ordered a late dessert and it was amazing and not overpriced, the same with breakfast. Great hotel for a romantic getaway and to go with the kids!
reviews.title: Best possible location in Monterey
Three generations of "women" 73, 45 and 8 years old
reviews.text: The decor of this room was nicely done and the rooms were clean. The fluffy white comforters were very inviting.

I stayed at the Portola in late March 2008 while traveling the California coast by motorcycle. We got a good room rate online, and had a professional reception by doormen, front desk, etc. The room was acceptable; unexpected semi-asian decor of reasonable quality. Our budget room had a view of a rooftop. Oh well.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Horrible Brewpub
Beuatiful Monterey, ok hotel
reviews.text: The low point of our stay was dinner at Peter B's Brew Pub in the hotel. We were feeling casual and it seemed like a good choice. The restaurant was rather slow, with probably 30-40% of the tables occupied. We were seated quickly and then the wait began. It took about 5 minutes to see our server. Our drinks came soon enough, but she forgot water. 10-12 minutes later, we got our water. We ordered an appetizer and dinner. Dinner came out about 20 minutes later. It was acceptable for low end bar food, but disappointing for a nice hotel. By the time we were finishing dinner, our appetizer arrived. Nachos. Stale. And Burnt. I decided to have a drink and ordered. Another 10 minutes + passed before my obviously complicated drink order (scotch in a glass with one ice cube) arrived. There was a mixup, as they had two similarly named scotches on the menu. I ordered the $10 glass and was given the $22 glass. I brought this up to the waitress who asked me to not worry about it, as she was giving us our military discount (as per restaurant policy). I worried. The manager came out another 10 minutes later and argued with me that I obviously ordered improperly and should pay $22.
This was not, in any way, a pleasant experience. I would not recommend them to anyone.
reviews.title: great llocation, nice hotel, noisy in some room locations

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Portola Hotel. It was nice when we walked in to the hotel and on the way to the room but when we got to the room we were unimpressed. We paid over 300.00 a night for a premium King room with a bay view, the bedspread and pillows and room decor needed updating, it all looked a little old and worn, the room was on the small side and the bay/water view was just ok, we we on the 6th floor but it was more of a peek out a around view than direct on. We had a couples massage and the massages were great but they are redoing the spa right now so the massages are done in a makeshft room that was a hotel room. I would wait until the spa is complete to get any other treatment.
reviews.title: Mixed bag, but over-priced

likes.disliked: — Very noisy location and inadquate sound-proofing windows.

reviews.text: On the good side, the employees and the valet were very nice. The breakfast bar food at Jacks Restaurant that came with the room everyday was soooo yummy. The hotel location was great, We were able to rent bikes right outside the hotel. We went on the Wine Trolley that picked up right out front, Their was an awesome farmers market right out front on Wednesdays that went on for blocks and blocks. The wharf was a 2 minute walk from the hotel and there were plenty restaurants to walk to and Monterey this time of year is just beautiful.
reviews.title: Weekend in Hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a weekend in Monterey to attend a festival and stayed at the Portola Hotel. This was our second stay at this hotel, and we were just as happy with it this time around as we were 3 years ago. Wonderful hotel, great location, very good staff.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Portola

reviews.text: The hotel is in a terrific location - next to the Moterey History Park and very close to the wharves, the ocean, and downtown. This makes it very easy to walk to many restaurants and activities. There are some small beaches nearby - great for strolling and playing in the water. There is also a pedestrian and bike path that runs very close to the hotel. A very nice 10-15 minute walk takes you to Canery Row.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with our previous stay, our room was quite comfortable and reasonably spacious. The hotel employees were all very gracious.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful experience

reviews.text: The only drawback of this hotel is the parking - there is a $17/night charge for self-parking in the garage, $20/night for valet. The garage itself is conviniently located though and hotel guests have unlimited in-and-out privelages.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Monterey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a wonderful time at the hotel. I celebrated my birthday with my family and enjoyed the scenery and beauty of Monterey. Marco was so kind and helpful to us in the restaurant. I would recommend this hotel to any visitor.
reviews.title: Quality stay

aka: Portola Hotel And Spa At Monterey Bay
description: Portola Hotel & Spa is located on the waterfront Monterey. Just steps away from historic Fisherman’s Wharf and the Monterey Bay, the hotel offers 379 nautically inspired guest rooms and suites, two onsite eateries, a full service day spa and much more!
